p: There were no RVF outbreaks confirmed during the surveillance period, most likely because the predicted El Ni√±o rainfall was not received. However, it is important to note that 27% of the farmers reported having vaccinated their livestock against RVF within the previous three months, and surveys in these RVF high-risk regions have typicaly reported >10% seropositivity in livestock, and up to 20% seropositivity in humans [ 22]. Given that occurrence of RVF epidemics seems to require low herd immunity, this level of immunity may have also have reduced the risk of RVF outbreak in the country.
